content.description: Loved or hated, Schoolio climbs the right corner of the Comic Gallery/Ice Cave Wall.
content.location: If Facing the Comic Gallery, it is the route on the right side corner.

content.description: Scramble up through a sea of jugs and ledges to the second bolt above the bulge. It is suggested to high clip the second before moving upward. Pull the bulge and continue up a vertical face to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 Bolts and 2 bolt anchor with permadraws
content.location: Start on the section of rock right of the large fallen tree stump where the rock looks more gnarled up than the rest.

content.description: Money may not grow on trees, but sweet moves do. Great flow leads to the money tree at the very top of the route. Grab it (at your own risk), muscle up and mantel to the anchor clipping holds!
content.protection: 7 bolts and 2 bolt anchor with permadraws
content.location: Start is between the large fallen tree stump and the ice cave wall

content.description: Dirty lid it the usually dirty crack about halfway between Schoolio and the cave. Can be lead on gear but remember this is Iowa limestone. Can also be TR'ed off a tree. The main crack starts about 25 feet off the deck.
content.location: Obvious crack on the left about halfway between the Comic Gallery and the cave.

content.description: Climbs a short vertical section, runs out on a slab to the anchors.
content.location: From the Ice Cave go up and around on the right side, only bolted line.

content.description: Lots of bolts to permadrawed anchors. Could be a great option for a beginner lead climber as nothing is runout. Vertical face climbing to the top!
content.protection: 10 draws for bolts and 2 for anchors
content.location: Start on a line of nice circular jug pockets on good stone.

content.description: Two routes got chopped on this wall Ice Cave, and Ice Cave Direct. The main climb on this wall is Schoolio.
